title: Move filter copying not moving
content: I have created sub-folders under the inbox and then created filters to "move" incoming emails from the inbox to one of the appropriate sub-folders. However, while that worked in the past, now while it does take the incoming email and transfers it to the sub-folder, it is leaving emails in the inbox, in effect doing a copy and not a move. As no indicator or the email number appeared next to the inbox, it wasn't until I actually clicking on the inbox where I found almost 1,000 emails there that I had already managed from the sub-folders. I have double checked the message filters, and it definitely indicates to move the emails, not copy.
creator: dave0judy

title: Can't install extensions in Thunderbird (several versions) on Chromebook (Linux Mint OK)
content:
Hi,

I've been using Thunderbird on Windows and Linux for years, and I'm very happy there.

I just bought a nice Chromebook with an i5, 16 GB RAM and a 256 GB SSD.

Chomeos installs a container of Debian Linux 11 and supports flatpak apps too.

I've tried using the debian apt install thunderbird and the Flatpak version too. Mostly 115.*.

I can't get any extensions to install directly, or after downloading the .xpi file. Thunderbird never lets you click on the last button to get the extension to install. Thunderbird must be force closed.

So, my success has been to choose debug extensions, and install the file as temporary. THIS WORKS! The extensions load and operate perfectly.

The downer is I'm having to re-install the temporary addons every time I run Thunderbird.

I'm willing to do some extended troubleshooting, debugging, upload logs, pics, whatever you folks need to provide a solution for this.

I'll install whatever beta/daily versions there are in order to get this resolved for everyone with a Chromebook. It seems there are lots of other folks with Chrome OS Linux that can't load extensions.

It is "technically" I think a Linux virtual machine or as they call it a container.

I have lots of other Linux apps running happily. Libre Office runs great, as do video editors, etc...

I'm even willing to do a screencast video reproducing the problem. I'll do that later on. I'll post a link to the video so experts can watch exactly what happens. A 2 minute video is often better than text.

If anyone wants to do remote debugging, or connect, or have me set up adb debugging I will do that also.

Anyway, let me know exactly what additional information is needed.

I'll post a short video in a bit.

Thanks.
creator: leowankerddd+tb

title: I encounter all kinds of basic errors and want to go back to straight Thunderbird, No supernova anymore

Now I am backat last that I can use my competer again but Supernova is too unstable for me and I want to go back to Thunderbird old style. How can I install the Old Style Thunderbird again.

title: SENT emails go into SPAM folder
content:
Hello,

When I send an email the SENT copy goes into SPAM. I haven't figure out yet if it is just some of the emails or all of them, because it happens sometimes not all the time. Recently, the whole SENT folder content landed into the SPAM folder. I read on the forum here, that I should whitelist my addresses books. I did it, and I put special attention on doing it with my own email address. My believe is that my address has been replicated and someone sends me SPAM from the very same email address I use. Therefore, I whitelisted it on the server setting under Thunderbird settings. When a I receive a SPAM email from my own email address I just delete it.

But, now it is happening again and my own SENT emails land into the SPAM folder.

Is this a Thunderbird issue or my email server issue? How can I fix it?

Thank you so much in advance for your help.

Regards,

title: Messages won't send automatically; I have to manually "Send Unsent Messages" from Outbox
content:
Hi --

I have two gmail accounts. I've confirmed and re-confirmed all the SMTP settings. The weird part is that if O compose and send a message (command+return), messages just end up sitting in the outbox. I think that's what error #3 below is from. But if I then right click on Outbox and "Send Unsent Messages", they go out fine. Why would that be? They're both using the exact same SMTP settings?

I see the following three errors in the error console:

1. TypeError: nameField is null | LoginManagerPrompter.sys.mjs:67:23

2. NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIAutoCompleteInput.popup] | LoginManagerChild.sys.mjs:149

3. mailnews.smtp: NetworkTimeoutError: a Network error occurred | SmtpClient.jsm:442:17

This problem started happening early this week or late last week. I've tried both Troubleshoot Mode as well as a clean install.

Thunderbird 115.5.1 MacOS Ventura 13.5.1

Thanks in advance, tarek

title: Lost emails from one computer, can I replace with files from another computer?
content:
While trying to move emails from my inbox to a folder, several months worth of emails disappeared. I've tried doing a global search for them, but there's no trace of them.

I have access to the same email account using Thunderbird on two separate Macs. So one computer's Thunderbird has all of my emails, but the other computer's Thunderbird is now missing those several months.

I've tried using a Time Machine app to reverse the Thunderbird profile folder in the Mac's Library, but that didn't work.

Can I take the Thunderbird folder from the Mac's Library on the unaffected computer and simply copy-and-paste to the affected computer? When I tried looking up other help articles about doing this, I'm reading warnings that this action could negatively affect the emails on the good computer.

I also want to ensure that I'm copying the emails from the good computer, and not exporting them, thus removing them from the good computer. I want to continue having the same emails on two computers.

I'm also open to other suggestions for how to retrieve my lost emails.

Thanks in advance for responses on this.
